duties_responsibilities.duty: Greet and welcome guests in the warmest manner.
Provide assistance to the guests at all times.
Communicate with the guest in a clear and professional manner.
Perform all treatments and services as required by the standards of the Spa/hotel.
Explain facial treatments and products used, which include techniques and benefits.
Knowledgeable on all spa products used including ingredients, contraindications, and benefits.
Provide a guest with a prescription card, which lays out the products recommended for purchase and how to use at home.
Handle opening and closing procedures.
Set up, stock linen and products, clean treatment rooms, and dispensary daily.
Disinfect and sanitize equipment & implements after each use.
Follow the cosmetology rules and regulations.
Report to Spa Manager any guest skin reactions or guest concerns.
Clean the spa daily or as needed.
Read and update the daily logbook and communicate relevant information.
Maintain a safe, sanitary, and professional work area.
Attend meetings and training as requested.
Promote all treatments and products offered in the spa and salon.
Requisition supplies or place orders accordingly.
Utilize the phone according to the Post Oak standards.
Respond properly in any hotel emergency or safety situation.
Perform other tasks or projects as assigned by hotel management.
Understand and be fully versed on The Post Oak standards, procedures, and guest confidentiality.
Be certified in CPR (Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation).
Work flexible days/hours as needed based on the business demands of the spa/hotel.
Good speech and hearing required to handle phones and communicate with the guest.
Standing, walking, bending, squatting, kneeling, and half kneeling for cleaning. Lifting and carrying towels, carrying gallon container of product. Overhead reaching.
